snippet: A Supreme Court endorsement of gay marriage would still leave many parents fighting to share custody of their same-sex partner’s children.
abstract: Supreme Court decision on nationwide legalization of same-sex marriage, if ruling is favorable, will still leave some parental issues unresolved; ruling would extend the right to adopt to gay couples, but nonbiological parents will likely have to go through courts in order to cement legal ties with their partner's children.
lead_paragraph: A Supreme Court endorsement of gay marriage would still leave many parents fighting to share custody of their same-sex partner’s children.

headline.main: Same-Sex Parents’ Rights May Be Unresolved After Justices’ Ruling
headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Parents’ Rights May Be Unresolved

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
